name: Fireeye ETP
description: Cloud Edition provides RESTful APIs for custom integration. The APIs are provided for Advanced Threats, Email Trace, and Quarantine functionalities

base_url.description: The URL for your ETP instance

actions.description: Validate the asset configuration for connectivity using the supplied configuration
Callback action for the on_poll ingest functionality
actions.verbose: Ingest alerts from ETP into Phantom. If 'start_time' is not specified, the default is past 10 days. If 'end_time' is not specified, the default is past 10 days.

container_id.description: Container IDs to size the ingestion to

start_time.description: Start of the time range, in epoch time (milliseconds)

end_time.description: End of the time range, in epoch time (milliseconds)

container_count.description: The maximum number of container records to query for

artifact_count.description: The maximum number of artifact records to query for

actions.description: Get a list of alerts from the ETP instance
actions.verbose:
The email status allows filtering by specific statuses. The valid values for email status are:

  • ACE: Passthrough
  • quarantined
  • released
  • deleted
  • bcc:dropped
  • delivered (retroactive)
  • dropped (oob retroactive)

legacy_id.description: Alert ID as shown in Email Security Web Portal

email_status.description: Filter by ETP email status. Comma-separated list allowed. See app documentation for a list of acceptable values

num_days.description: The number of days to get alerts for (ETP Defaults to last 90 days)

size.description: Number of alerts to retrieve per response. Valid range: 1-200 (ETP Defaults to 20)

actions.description: Get details about a specific alert from the ETP instance
actions.verbose: Get details about a specific alert by alert ID.

alert_id.description: Alert ID as shown in Email Security Web Portal

actions.description: Get all the attributes from a list of email messages
actions.verbose: Gets a list of messages that include specified message attributes that are accessible in the Email Security portal.

size.description: The number of alerts to include in a response. Valid range: 1-200 (ETP Defaults to 20)

example_values: 250 2.6.0 <97be1b3701c4b71faec8bf7b6.13bf5ad01b.20200614582589.d1f0cfbf6b.ad7426e6@mail.net> [InternalId=23782507632821, Hostname=outlook.com] 89009 bytes in 0.136, 564.397 KB/sec Queued mail for delivery

actions.description: Get the attributes of a particular message with the specified Email Security message ID

etp_message_id.description: The ID of the Email Security message

example_values: 250 2.6.0 <97be1b3701c4b71faec8bf7b6.13bf5ad01b.20200614582589.d1f0cfbf6b.ad7426e6@mail.net> [InternalId=23782507632821, Hostname=outlook.com] 89009 bytes in 0.136, 564.397 KB/sec Queued mail for delivery

actions.description: Search for Email Message by specifying one or more filters
actions.verbose:
At least one parameter must be filled out. All fields are filtered by the IN clause where applicable searching always an AND.

The modified date always uses the greater than or equal to. For example, if you want to search for the last 7 days, put a timestamp from 7 days ago. IE. 2017-10-03T00:00:00.000Z. Also, note that the DatetTime stamps need to be in UTC otherwise the results will be off. ETP assumes all DateTime stamps are in UTC.

The status field allows for the following values

  • accepted
  • deleted
  • delivered
  • delivered (retroactive)
  • dropped
  • dropped oob
  • dropped (oob retroactive)
  • permanent failure
  • processing
  • quarantined
  • rejected
  • temporary failure

The tags field allows for the following values

  • auto_remediation
  • impersonation
  • manual_remediation

domains.description: Specific domain(s) to search by. Comma-separated list allowed

modified_date.description: Datetime stamp to limit the search period

recipients.description: The recipients of the email. The maximum allowed per request is 10. Comma-separated list allowed

sender.description: The sender of the email. The maximum allowed per request is 10. Comma-separated list allowed

status.description: ETP status to search by. Comma-separated list allowed

subject.description: The subject of the email to search for

tags.description: Tags from ETP that are associated with an email

size.description: The number of alerts to include in a response. Valid range: 1-300 (ETP Defaults to 20)

example_values: 250 2.6.0 <97be1b3701c4b71faec8bf7b6.13bf5ad01b.20200614582589.d1f0cfbf6b.ad7426e6@mail.net> [InternalId=23782507632821, Hostname=outlook.com] 89009 bytes in 0.136, 564.397 KB/sec Queued mail for delivery

actions.description: Search for Email Message by specifying the Queue/Message-ID of the Downstream MTA or the Original Message-ID. At least one parameter must be filled out. All fields are filtered by the IN clause where applicable

size.description: The number of alerts to include in a response. Valid range: 1-300 (ETP Defaults to 20)

example_values: 250 2.6.0 <97be1b3701c4b71faec8bf7b6.13bf5ad01b.20200614582589.d1f0cfbf6b.ad7426e6@mail.net> [InternalId=23782507632821, Hostname=outlook.com] 89009 bytes in 0.136, 564.397 KB/sec Queued mail for delivery

250 2.6.0 <97be1b3701c4b71faec8bf7b6.13bf5ad01b.20200614582589.d1f0cfbf6b.ad7426e6@mail.net> [InternalId=23782507632821, Hostname=outlook.com] 89009 bytes in 0.136, 564.397 KB/sec Queued mail for delivery

actions.description: Download the email header as a text file and add it to the vault

etp_message_id.description: The ID of the Email Security message to download

actions.description: Downloads all the PCAP files of the alert for a specified alert ID and add the files to the vault

alert_id.description: The ID of the Email Security message to download

actions.description: Download all malware files of the alert for a specified alert ID and add the files to the vault
actions.verbose: These files can contain viruses or other malicious software. Be cautious when opening these files!

alert_id.description: The ID of the Email Security message to download

actions.description: Download all case files of the alert for a specified alert ID and add the files to the vault

alert_id.description: The ID of the Email Security message to download

actions.description: Enqueues the message IDs provided in the request for remediation from the user's Office365 mailbox
actions.verbose:
Note: There is no undo functionality with this action!

The permissions the API account needs to have to use this function are, etp.email_trace.update and etp.email_trace.delete. If the API user does not have these permission you will not be able to use this action.

Any Any ETP Messages that have a status from the list given below are ignored and no action will be taken on them.

  • Deleted
  • Dropped
  • Dropped(OOB)
  • Dropped (OOB Retroactive)
  • Rejected
  • Split
  • Permanent Failure

The action_override parameter allows you to override the default action for remediating an email. It is important to note that if you select Delete, that it is a permanent delete in Office365.

The move_to parameter allows you to move the identified emails to a specific folder. If the folder is not in the user's mailbox, a new custom folder will be created and then the email will be moved into the new folder. Common Office365 folders are

  • junk email
  • junkemail
  • deleted items
  • deleteditems
These folder names are not case sensitive.

etp_message_ids.description: A comma-separated list of ETP Message IDs

action_override.description: Allows you to override the default action

move_to.description: When 'move' is chosen for action_override, this parameter is mandatory and allows you to specify the folder to move the email to

actions.description: Download the email file present in the quarantine for the given Email Security message ID and add it to the vault

etp_message_id.description: The ID of the Email Security message to download

actions.description: Release the email file(s) present in the Quarantine within ETP

etp_message_id.description: The ID of the Email Security message to unquarantine. Allows for a comma-separated string of IDs

is_not_spam.description: Report as not spam to the Spam Engines

headers_only.description: Share only the email headers with Spam Engines

example_values: Invalid etp message ID or the message ID does not exist in quarantine

actions.description: Delete the email file(s) present in quarantine for the given Email Security message ID

etp_message_id.description: The ID of the Email Security message to delete. Allows a comma-separated string of IDs

actions.description: Get a list of quarantined emails from a given query filter
actions.verbose: When specifying a date in either the to or from dates, the date is assumed to be in UTC. The ETP server runs on UTC so if you are not converting the timestamp to that time the results will be off.

from_date.description: Start date to use to search the by. Date in YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SS.SSSSSS in UTC

to_date.description: End date to use to search by. Date in YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SS.SSSSSS in UTC

domains.description: Specific domain(s) to search by. Comma-separated list allowed

email_server.description: Specific email server to search by

from.description: Email address of the sender to search by

reason.description: Reason the email was quarantined. The strings must be of the following reasons, Action, Advanced Threat, Policy, Spam or Virus. Comma-separated list allowed

recipients.description: Recipient(s) to search by. Comma-separated list allowed

sender_domain.description: The senders domain to search by

subject.description: The subject of the email to search by

size.description: THe number of alerts to include in response. Valid range: 1-200 (ETP Defaults to 20)

tags.description: Tag associated with email. Must be of the follow tags, auto_remediation, impersonation or manual_remediation. Comma-separated list allowed
